dealSummary:
Scope: EasyLink (FTS) Replacement Solution, Client is new customer, Buy/Sell-side program,


If the client chooses full P2P mapping, then:

All P2P Maps: 0 maps (0 base, 0 clone, 0 complex, 0 FS Complex), Sales Assumption,

Forms (IWF 0, TG4E 0)


1 Total TPs, 0 existing TPs (0 direct, 0 VAN), 1 new TPs (1 direct, 0 VAN),

AT with 1 TPs, Schedule: Project Duration in wks (SI/CL/Total): 7/0/9, Start Date: Not Specified, End Date: Not Specified, Resource Allocation: All resources within recommended guidelines.


Notes:

- Receive files from Lloyds using SFTP and sending these files on to a FTS Gateway (EasyLink legacy service that runs out of OT data center (Slough)).

- Customer backend connections: SFTP connection (Lloyds acting as SFTP client, OT to be SFTP Server)

- Create an MS platform

- Set-up an sFTP connection to Lloyds back

- Implement a Passthru flow

- Send files to external Easylink service ‘FTS Gateway’

- FTS Gateway will handle the delivery of the files to external partner

- Average monthly KC: 1000000

- 1 go live event


Assumptions:

- All FTS Gateway-related configurations are out of scope for this SRQ and are quoted separately by the remaining EasyLink support team

notes.text:
Discussion was had today on the cost and support of the FTS setups. Currently we do not charge anything on the easylink FTS Gateway when something needs to be setup, the ask from sales was could this continue.


In order to understand this a few points are noted


  • No action needed on TG MS side as all data is sent to easylink FTS gateway via a single SFTP mailbox
  • Support is John Skouros, Darren Ellis and Suzzane Ekford and this will continue and need to determine how to push a request to this team if / when required
  • CSM overhead to manage this process
  • Platform availability does not cover Easylink FTS, and will be called out in the SOF (confirmed by Sven)
  • Support do not offer resolution time on Easylink FTS and will be called out in the SOF (confirmed by Sven)
  • Swami confirmed no TG effort needed


Larger concerns exist on the long term platform as this is a very old solution which has no technical solution knowledge for any changes and support is limited to 3 individuals.

dealSummary:

If the client chooses full P2P mapping, then:

All P2P Maps: 24 maps (0 base, 0 clone, 24 complex, 0 FS Complex), Sales Assumption,

Forms (IWF 0, TG4E 0)

Request to Hire: (x ContractOnshore_Hire, y ContractOffshore_Hire, z ContractNearshore_Hire, x CAPOnshore_Hire, y CAPOffshore_Hire, z CAPNearshore_Hire)

2 Total TPs, 0 existing TPs (0 direct, 0 VAN), 2 new TPs (2 direct, 0 VAN),

AT with 10 TPs, Schedule: Project Duration in wks (SI/CL/Total): 20/0/22, Start Date: Not Specified, End Date: Not Specified, Resource Allocation: All resources within recommended guidelines.

Notes:

  -  New TG Customer with project for eInvoicing Germany, sending e-Invoices in ZugFeRD + Xrechnung via eMail and PEPPOL

  -  ZUGFeRD format invoices to be sent via SMTP Relay using common mailbox approach

  -  XRechnung CII & PEPPOL Bis3 UBL to be sent using PEPPOL common mailbox feature

  -  Inbound is out of scope

  -  Reduced EMEA CSM allocation approved by Steve C at five percent (5%) offshore. Note that if this reduced option is applied then request for German speaking CSM is rejected as OT cannot provide German speaking offshore CSM resource

  -  Sales request a CSM allocation option at ten percent (10%) onshore, see separate EE

 

  -  Eight (8) new customer backend connection, SFTP (Server) per Sales assumption

  -  One (1) LENS User Group

  -  Twenty five (25) divisiosn of divisional security

  -  Two (2) transaction type : Invoice and Credit Note outbound

  -  Correlation included for all twenty four (24) maps

  -  ERC not included, assumption is Customer will be mandate ready

  -  Customer will not be able to provide 30 days of test data

  -  Forty percent (40%) map reduction applied on assumption of Non-EDI TP AIC Mandate Deals with use of Biz (not AI) mapping per Deb Russell

  -  Direct Connects sales assumption : 

              - 25 x PEPPOL Customer IDs for Germany, assumption OT will utilise the Global/common PEPPOL approach

              - PEPPOL schematron validation for one (1) format (Germany) (PS effort per Bastien in Other Needs)

              - 1 x generic STMP email mailbox (Germany) to send invoices PDF to TP via SMTP Relay

              - One (1) x SMTP relay to configure (1 per country) on outbound emails. the outgoing email will appear to have been sent by customer email account (PS effort in Other Needs)

              - Email template will not be customised, per Nell no additional PS effort needed for this requirement

              - Email bouncebacks/send failures will be handled by client as they will not be received by OT

  -  Remote kickoff

  -  Project Manager & Delivery Manager requested to be English and German speaking. OT will endeavor to provide German speaking resources. In the event that German speaking resources shall not be readily available, we reserve the right to deploy English speaking until such time that a resource becomes available

  -  Average monthly KC: 1,500,000

  -  One (1) Go-live

  -  BNS is requested to be both German and English speaking

 AIC - Domestic, Germany

  -  Twenty five (25) Customer legal entity profile - In Other Needs per AIC estimation calculator

  -  Three (3) unique input AIC invoice formats

  -  Three (3) AIC Map in scope (in separate EE)

  -  Two (2) eBiller TP (1 profile ZUGFeRD eMail & 1 profile Xrechnung PEPPOL)

  -  eBiller Invoices Sent per Month - Unsigned : 150,000

  -  AIC consultant for 16 hrs per country per SOP, to be exercised during project

 Additional

- OT will not integrate any individual TPs

notes.text: Sales requested a reduced CSM and so approved a 5% Offshore on the 26th August
28th August, sales have asked for optional 10% Onshore.

dealSummary: Standard France DPDP deployment. Agreement to start at 5% onshore.

Boots has an issue with the current model of 10 concurrent requests as they are finding it limiting, but also realizing that they are experiencing internal constraints which may not help them expand beyond 10 requests.


Sales is exploring both RTS and ECM for boots.

notes.text:
Spoke with Suhel and the main issue is CAT in that this is taking the majority of the time, so RTS wouldn't fix this, ECM may help them to control it.


Boots have also outsourced their work to a 3rd party, which may not be helping.

dealSummary:
New eInvoicing opportunity for Belgium.


this will form part of the global framework and be implemented on their existing MS, no incremental CSM is required.
TG Jones is a divestiture from WH Smith, they will need to have a new MS instance setup on TG and have all maps re-written in Contivo

notes.text:
Sales (Owen) has split out the initial deal which had a price which included the initial implementation, WH Smiths will be paying for this and so they have issued a CR which is for this initial implementation of £73,100


This will not go-live unless TG Jones purchases an MS Agreement.

Hi Steve, 


Hope you’re doing well. Happy to clarify the context behind the closed opportunity with WH Smith, I understand there below confusion, rest assured this is not the 'final product' and there is no expectation to support this CR with our ongoing services. 


We have signed a deal with WH Smith in which they are paying for transition services aligned with their divested arm of the business, previously ‘WH Smith High Street’ now ‘TG Jones’ after being brought by PE firm Modella. WH Smith have to pay for any work aligned with the splitting of existing setups and creation of new ones hence why we have an agreement with them for the PS Services. TG Jones being a new customer to OpenText will need their own MS contract, this is something that was central to discussions and has also been written into the contract in clause 11. This means that we will not go live with the solution if no service agreement is in place, eliminating the risk for us. 


Mike’s MM team will pick up the opportunity on the new contract with TG Jones, we are in a strong position as we are the only option for them, timelines are tight with a clear deadline (14th November cutover weekend as per TSA) and the build already committed. We are currently waiting for WH Smith to share who the procurement stakeholder will be for the negotiation of the new TG Jones agreement. 


Let me know if you have any further questions on this topic. 


Best, 

Owen

dealSummary: Baxters are an existing MS customer and they have an a requirement to support the Poland eInvoicing mandate, as this is now requiring a new MS we for TG, we may want to consider moving this out of ADM

Notes:

- Existing Customer with project for email2EDI implementation

- TP Client to send to Customer, Customer then forwarded to TG

- Existing EMEA CSM allocation applies, no incremental needed per Steve C

- No (0) new backend connections, existing backedn connection(s) will be utilised per Sales assumption

- One (1) transaction type: Inbound Orders

- Correlation included for the one (1) map

- One (1) SMTP (email) TP setup for the one (1) Customer sender email address to forward PDF to OT

- CAT assumed to be with one (1) TPs

- Average monthly KC: 8,000

- Average monthly number of transactions : 4,000

- Remote kickoff

- One (1) Go-live


EMAIL2EDI

- Multi-country in Europe; Austria, Germany Switzerland, France, Sweden, Finland, Netherlands, Chechia, Belgium, Hungary, Denmark, Spain, UK, Luxemburg, Slovakia, Romania

- Thirty five (35) unique layouts per Sales Assumption

- Assumption:

- Multi-language, all common European languages as supported by OCC: German, French, English, Dutch, Hungarian, Polish, Slovak, and more..

- thirty five (35) templates

- five (5) header fields, four (4) line items, fifteen (15) averageline item rows

- Four thousand (4000) TPs behind the one (1) Customer email address

- One (1) Cusomer email address (sending to single OT mailbox)

- Five (5) users requiring the ability to validate documents

- Number of image files per month: 4000

- Number of pages per month: 8000

- Average daily pages: 400

- Invoice will be forwarded in by Customer. 1 Direct Connect MS TP ijncluded for this inbound SMTP connection

- Incoming email will have single attachment of single PDF – ie not multiple attachments in 1 email and not multiple orderss in 1 PDF file

- Email attachment file format assumed to be application generated PDF (not scanned PDF)

notes.text: No incremental CSM required for this deal with the assumption that it will be implemented on their existing MS instance.
